Classon Avenue Presbyterian Church property records
Classon Avenue Presbyterian Church property records
This collection consists of legal documents relating to the property of the Classon Avenue Presbyterian Church of Brooklyn spanning the period 1867 to 1961.
This collection consists of legal documents relating to the property of the Classon Avenue Presbyterian Church of Brooklyn spanning the period 1867 to 1961.
Classon Avenue Presbyterian Church (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
Classon Avenue Presbyterian Church (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
Classon Avenue Presbyterian Church (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

This collection consists of legal documents spanning the period 1867 to 1961 and relating to the property of the Classon Avenue Presbyterian Church of Brooklyn. Items include bonds, memoranda, mortgage assignments, releases, and title abstracts. Records also include a survey of the property, with a block and lot plan, as well as information pertaining to the prior ownership of the property from 1766 onward.
The Classon Avenue Presbyterian Church of Brooklyn opened in 1869. Its first pastor was Joseph P. Duryea. The Church merged with the Bedford-Central Presbyterian Church in 1961.
Gift of Edgerton G. North, 1962.
Brooklyn Historical Society
